com.krzysztof.pajak.note.detect

Class NoteDetect

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.krzysztof.pajak.note.detect.NoteDetect

  • public class NoteDetect
extends java.lang.Object
    NoteDetect provides main library interface. This class' goal is to provide quick and easy way to use the most important library functions. Constructor takes samples as an input. Samples should contain as few as possible distinct sounds to give best results. Method run() runs signal processing algorithms, such as filters and FFT, and returns most probable notes played.
    Author:
    Krzysztof Paj¹k

      • NoteDetect

        public NoteDetect(float[] samples)
        Class constructor specifying input samples. Samples should contain as few as possible distinct sounds to give best results. Sampling rate is set as default 44100 (Hz).
        Parameters:
        samples - Input sound samples, in time domain (standard representation).

      • setAlgorithm

        public <T extends AbstractAlgorithm> void setAlgorithm(java.lang.Class<T> algorithmClass)
                                                throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                                       java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Changes algorithm that converts data from time domain to frequency domain (FFT or similar algorithms). Parameter have to be a subclass of AbstractAlgorithm. It has to implement run() method.
        Parameters:
        algorithmClass - Class that extends AbstractAlgorithm class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException

      • run

        public java.lang.String[] run(double tolerance)
                       throws InvalidAlgorithmException,
                              InputSamplesException,
                              InvalidNoteException
        Main library interface and fast way to get estimated notes without in-depth study of other classes and methods provided in library.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - Tolerance for estimating, 1.0 is most strict, 0.0 least.
        Returns:
        Returns most probable notes played on input samples data.
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmException
        InputSamplesException
        InvalidNoteException
